Plantation Road Lab
The purpose of this website is to make it easier to access course materials including assignment pdfs and videos for virtual labs. This website is also designed to promote interactivity. You are encouraged to comment on an assignment page if you have any questions. Questions can be answered by fellow students or the instructor. If a question is asked for which a detailed explanation will benefit the entire class, a seperate page will be made to answer that question.
Why Mineral Processing Lab? Mines sell a product to a customer. The product was obtained by processing material removed from the earth.
During your career you will make decisions and interact with people. The decisions of a mine operator, engineer, or equipment designer effect the quality of the product or the quantity produced. You may interact with executives (or become one yourself), sales, or a customer. You need to be able to understand and describe how one product differs from another, as well as the costs associated with those differences.
First hand knowledge of how to quantify specifications and costs of a product is necessary for any individual involved in producing that product. Executives at amazon understand the costs involved in how they process their products including transportation, warehousing, and packaging costs, as well as the importance of presenting information and adequately describing their products to their customers. For an individual working in the mining industry, it is just as important to understand the costs related to and differences in processed mineral products.
summary: Easy to access portal for MINE 3544, Mineral Processing Lab

content:
The BayesMassBal (V. 0.2.0) package, used for Bayesian data reconciliation of a chemical or particulate process, is now available from CRAN.
The purpose of this package is to make the advantages Bayesian data reconciliation more accessible to students, professionals, and educators. The BayesMassBal package includes functions making it easy for users to organize data, specify linear constraints, and implement Bayesian data reconciliation models.
The site for the package contains the package manual, and an example vignette. The first step to get started is type
install.packages("BayesMassBal") into the R console. Development versions of the BayesMassBal package can be downloaded directly from github using the devtools package:
devtools::install_github("skoermer/BayesMassBal") If there are features, examples, or extra documentation you would like to see included in this package, please contact me or comment below.
The idea for this package did not come out of thin air, more on Bayesian Data reconciliation forthcoming…
summary: Celebrating the initial release of statistical software useful for Bayesian data reconsciliation of chemical and particulate processes.
title: Introducing the BayesMassBal Package for R

ETD 50 was a DOE funded project on the separation of rare earth elements from acid mine drainage. A pilot scale plant was constructed and tested at West Virginia University. My role in the project was primarially modeling and data visualization.
